    • Klotski

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create()
      Initializes the game environment by setting up core components, resources, and services. This includes: - Creating a random helper instance - Setting background color and theme music (light theme by default) - Loading UI skin and configuring font/viewport - Establishing WebSocket connections (both client and server) unless in offline mode - Starting local web server on port8013 - Creating game screens (Settings, Login, Main) and setting initial screen - Initializing WebSocket server on port8014 - Configuring custom cursor graphics - Preloading sound effects for UI interactions and game events - Handling login status loading and connection timeouts - Managing resource disposal for cursor pixmaps The method follows a specific initialization order where music loading precedes configuration loading, and settings screen creation precedes login status checks.

    • getLoggedInUser

      public String getLoggedInUser()
      Retrieves the username of the currently logged-in user. If no user is logged in, the method returns the default value "Guest".
      Returns:
      A string representing the logged-in user's name, or "Guest" if no user is logged in.

    • setLoggedInUser

      public void setLoggedInUser(String username, String token)
      Sets the logged-in user's credentials and persists the login status. This method updates the current user's username and associated authentication token, then triggers a save operation to ensure the login state is retained across sessions or application restarts.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the logged-in user. This value should correspond to an authenticated user's identifier and cannot be null or empty.
      token - The authentication token associated with the logged-in user. This token is typically used for subsequent authorized operations and must be valid to maintain session integrity.

    • setLoggedInUser

      public void setLoggedInUser(String username)
      Sets the logged-in user's username and persists the login status. This method updates the currently logged-in user to the specified username and immediately triggers a save operation to retain the updated login state. It should be called whenever the user's authentication status changes to ensure consistent tracking of the active user session.
      Parameters:
      username - the name of the user to set as the logged-in user; may be null to clear the logged-in user.

    • saveLoginStatus

      public void saveLoginStatus()
      Saves the current login status by writing the logged-in user's username and authentication token to a persistent file. The username is written on the first line and the token on the second line. If no user is logged in (loggedInUser is null), an empty string is written for the username. Similarly, an empty string is written for the token if it is null. The file is overwritten each time this method is called. If an I/O error occurs during writing, an error message is printed to the standard error stream, but no exception is propagated.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if a security manager exists and denies write access to the file.

    • clearLoginStatus

      public void clearLoginStatus()
      Clears the current logged-in user status and removes the login status file if it exists. This method resets the loggedInUser to null to indicate no active user session and deletes the persistent login status file stored at LOGIN_STATUS_FILE to ensure no residual login data remains. If the file does not exist, no action is taken for the file deletion step. This is typically called during user logout or session termination to maintain security and data consistency.

    • render

      public void render()
      Renders the component by invoking the superclass's render method. This delegates the rendering logic to the parent class implementation, ensuring any rendering behavior defined in the superclass is executed. This method is typically called as part of the component's lifecycle to display or update its visual representation. Overriding this method allows customization while preserving the superclass's core rendering functionality.
      Specified by:
      render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
      Overrides:
      render in class com.badlogic.gdx.Game

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of all managed resources and gracefully shuts down the application. This includes:
      • Disposing LibGDX resources such as the rendering batch and font.
      • Stopping and closing the WebSocket server (if active), ensuring graceful termination and socket closure.
      • Closing the WebSocket client (if active), marking the socket for closure and waiting for termination.
      • Shutting down the web server (if running) and releasing its resources.
      • Disposing of background music resources and dereferencing them for garbage collection.
      • Exiting the LibGDX application framework and terminating the JVM via System.exit(0).
      Handles exceptions during resource cleanup by printing stack traces. Logs a confirmation message upon completion. Ensures all resources are dereferenced to facilitate garbage collection.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
      Overrides:
      dispose in class com.badlogic.gdx.Game

    • getWebSocketServer

      public GameWebSocketServer getWebSocketServer()
      Retrieves the current instance of the GameWebSocketServer associated with this object. This method provides access to the WebSocket server instance, which is responsible for managing real-time communication between clients and the game server via WebSocket connections. The returned instance can be used to interact with active sessions, broadcast messages, or configure server settings.
      Returns:
      the active GameWebSocketServer instance, or null if the server has not been initialized or started.

    • getWebSocketClient

      public GameWebSocketClient getWebSocketClient()
      Retrieves the GameWebSocketClient instance associated with this object. This method provides access to the web socket client used for real-time communication with the game server, allowing interaction with connection events, message handling, and other web socket operations.
      Returns:
      the current GameWebSocketClient instance, or null if no web socket client has been initialized or set.

    • setGlClearColor

      public void setGlClearColor()
      Sets the OpenGL clear color based on the current KlotskiTheme. When the theme is LIGHT, the clear color is set to a light blue color with RGBA values (0.68,0.85,0.9,1). For all other themes (e.g., DARK), the clear color is set to a dark gray with RGBA values (0.25,0.25,0.25,1). This method updates both the internal glClearColor instance variable and the active OpenGL state via Gdx.gl.glClearColor.

    • getGlClearColor

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color getGlClearColor()
      Returns the current clear color used by the OpenGL context. This color is applied when clearing the color buffer during rendering, typically set via android.opengl.GLES20#glClearColor. The returned Color object contains the RGBA components defining the clear color, which defaults to a platform-specific value unless explicitly set. This value determines the background color of the rendering surface before drawing a new frame.
      Returns:
      The current clear color as a Color object, representing the RGBA values used to clear the framebuffer. Modifying the returned object will not affect the internal clear color unless it is explicitly set again via #setGlClearColor(Color).

    • getBackgroundColor

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns the background color based on the current Klotski theme setting. When the theme is set to KlotskiTheme.LIGHT, the returned color is a light blue with RGB values (0.68,0.85,0.9) and full opacity. When the theme is set to a non-light value (typically KlotskiTheme.DARK), the returned color is a dark gray with RGB values (0.25,0.25,0.25) and full opacity. The alpha component for both colors is set to1 (fully opaque).
      Returns:
      A Color object representing the background color corresponding to the active theme.

    • getMainScreenColorList

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color[] getMainScreenColorList()
      Returns an array of Color objects representing the main screen's color palette based on the current theme. When the theme is set to LIGHT, the returned colors include RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW, ORANGE, MAGENTA, CYAN, PINK, and GRAY. For other themes, the same colors are returned but with their RGB values scaled by0.5 to produce darker shades. The adjustment applies to all color components (red, green, blue) uniformly in non-LIGHT themes.
      Returns:
      an array of Color objects configured for the current KlotskiTheme.

    • getMainScreenLightColorList

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color[] getMainScreenLightColorList()
      Returns an array of predefined Color objects representing the available light colors for the main screen. The colors are returned in the following order: red, blue, green, yellow, orange, magenta, cyan, pink, and gray. This list is used to populate or configure the lighting elements displayed on the main screen interface.

    • isAntialiasingEnabled

      public boolean isAntialiasingEnabled()
      Returns the current state of the antialiasing setting. Antialiasing is a rendering technique used to smooth out jagged edges and improve visual quality in graphical elements. This method provides a simple check to determine whether antialiasing is enabled for the associated component or context.
      Returns:
      true if antialiasing is currently enabled, false if it is disabled.

    • setAntialiasingEnabled

      public void setAntialiasingEnabled(boolean enabled, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage)
      Enables or disables antialiasing for the specified stage by updating the internal configuration. This method sets the antialiasing state and triggers a configuration update for the rendering context associated with the provided stage. Note that the current implementation may not immediately apply visual changes due to technical limitations (as indicated by internal comments).
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable antialiasing, false to disable it.
      stage - The Stage instance whose rendering configuration should be updated to reflect the new antialiasing state.

    • isVsyncEnabled

      public boolean isVsyncEnabled()
      Returns whether vertical synchronization (VSync) is currently enabled. VSync is a graphics feature that synchronizes the application's frame rate with the display's refresh rate to prevent screen tearing. This method provides the current status of the VSync setting as a boolean value.
      Returns:
      true if VSync is enabled, indicating that frame rendering is synchronized with the display's refresh rate; false if VSync is disabled, allowing the application to render frames as quickly as possible without synchronization.

    • setVsyncEnabled

      public void setVsyncEnabled(boolean enabled, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage)
      Enables or disables vertical synchronization (V-Sync) for the specified stage. When enabled, V-Sync synchronizes the application's frame rate with the display's refresh rate to prevent screen tearing. This method updates the internal V-Sync state and triggers an immediate configuration update for the LWJGL3 backend associated with the provided stage.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable V-Sync, false to disable it.
      stage - The Stage instance for which the V-Sync configuration will be applied. The stage's LWJGL3 configuration is refreshed after modifying the V-Sync state.

    • setLwjgl3Config

      public void setLwjgl3Config(com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration config)
      Sets the LWJGL3 application configuration to the specified Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration object. This configuration is used to initialize and customize various settings for the LWJGL3 application window and context, such as window title, dimensions, OpenGL version, and other platform-specific parameters.
      Parameters:
      config - The Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration instance containing the desired configuration settings. This object defines parameters that control the application's window, graphics, and input handling.

    • updateLwjgl3Config

      public void updateLwjgl3Config(com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage stage)
      Updates the LWJGL3 application configuration based on current settings. This method checks and applies changes to VSync and antialiasing (MSAA) configurations. If any configuration change requires an application restart to take effect, a dialog is displayed to notify the user. Changes to VSync or antialiasing samples are only applied if they differ from the current configuration values. Note that the application is not automatically restarted; the user is prompted to restart manually.
      Parameters:
      stage - The UI stage used to display the restart notification dialog. Must not be null.
      See Also:
      • Checks if VSync is currently enabled.
      • Checks if antialiasing is currently enabled.
      • Retrieves the current VSync configuration.
      • Retrieves the current back buffer configuration.

    • getVsyncEnabled

      public boolean getVsyncEnabled(com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration config)
      Retrieves the vertical synchronization (vSync) enabled status from the provided Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration instance using reflection to access the private vSyncEnabled field of the Lwjgl3WindowConfiguration class. This method temporarily overrides the field's accessibility to read its boolean value. If the field cannot be accessed due to a NoSuchFieldException or IllegalAccessException, the exception is logged to the standard error stream, and the method returns false as a default value.
      Parameters:
      config - The configuration instance from which to retrieve the vSync status. Must be non-null.
      Returns:
      true if vertical synchronization is enabled according to the configuration's vSyncEnabled field, or false if an error occurs during reflection access.

    • getBackBufferConfig

      public int[] getBackBufferConfig(com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration config)
      Retrieves the back buffer configuration settings from the provided Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration instance. This method accesses private fields of the configuration object using reflection to obtain the red, green, blue, and alpha (RGBA) color channel bit depths, depth buffer bit depth, stencil buffer bit depth, and multisample anti-aliasing (MSAA) sample count. The values are returned as an integer array in the following order:
      • Index0: Red channel bit depth (r)
      • Index1: Green channel bit depth (g)
      • Index2: Blue channel bit depth (b)
      • Index3: Alpha channel bit depth (a)
      • Index4: Depth buffer bit depth (depth)
      • Index5: Stencil buffer bit depth (stencil)
      • Index6: MSAA sample count (samples)
      If an error occurs while accessing the fields via reflection (e.g., due to field name changes or access restrictions), this method prints the exception stack trace and returns null.
      Parameters:
      config - The Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration instance from which to extract back buffer settings.
      Returns:
      An integer array containing the back buffer configuration values in the order [r, g, b, a, depth, stencil, samples], or null if reflection fails to access any required field.

    • restartApplication

      public void restartApplication()
      Restarts the application by disposing the current instance and initializing a new one with the existing configuration. This method saves the current Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration, terminates the running application via Gdx.app, then creates a new Klotski instance, applies the saved configuration, and launches a new Lwjgl3Application. Note that this method is marked as experimental and may not function correctly in all contexts. Avoid using it until further testing and stabilization are completed.

    • playAlertSound

      public void playAlertSound()
      Plays the alert sound configured for this instance. This method attempts to trigger the playback of the sound resource referenced by alertSound. If the sound cannot be played due to an exception (e.g., missing resource, invalid format, or playback failure), the exception is caught and logged to the standard error stream. The method handles errors gracefully without propagating them, ensuring uninterrupted execution of the calling code. Intended for notifying users audibly when specific events or alerts occur.

    • playClickSound

      public void playClickSound()
      Plays a click sound effect by invoking the playback functionality of the associated sound resource. This method attempts to trigger the sound immediately when called. If an error occurs during playback (e.g., missing resource, audio initialization failure), the exception is caught and its stack trace is printed to the standard error stream for debugging purposes. The method ensures that unexpected exceptions do not propagate upward, preventing application crashes related to sound playback.

    • playBlockCollideSound

      public void playBlockCollideSound()
      Plays the block collision sound effect when called. This method attempts to trigger the audio associated with block collisions by invoking the underlying sound player. If an exception occurs during playback (e.g., audio file errors, resource loading issues), the exception is caught and its stack trace is printed to standard error. This ensures the application continues running gracefully even if sound playback fails.

    • setMusicEnabled

      public void setMusicEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether background music is enabled. If the background music instance is not null, this method will either start playing the music (if enabled is true) or stop it (if enabled is false), and update the internal state reflecting the music enabled status. If the background music is null, this method has no effect.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable and play the background music, false to disable and stop it.

    • isMusicEnabled

      public boolean isMusicEnabled()
      Checks whether the music playback feature is currently enabled. This method returns the current status of the music setting, indicating whether background music or audio effects are permitted to play based on user preferences or application configuration.
      Returns:
      true if music is enabled and allowed to play, false if music playback is disabled or muted by user/system settings.

    • setOfflineMode

      public void setOfflineMode(boolean offlineMode)
      Sets the offline mode status for this instance. When enabled, the application will operate without requiring a network connection, using locally cached data or resources where available. When disabled, the application will attempt to connect to remote services or resources as needed. This method directly updates the internal state controlling network-dependent behavior.
      Parameters:
      offlineMode - true to enable offline mode, false to disable it and resume normal network-dependent operations.

    • isOfflineMode

      public boolean isOfflineMode()
      Indicates whether the application is currently running in offline mode. This method returns the current status of offline mode, which determines if the application should avoid attempting network requests or rely solely on locally cached data.
      Returns:
      true if the application is configured to operate in offline mode, false if it is connected to network resources and operating normally.

    • setGameWebSocketClient

      public void setGameWebSocketClient(GameWebSocketClient client)
      Sets the GameWebSocketClient instance for this object. This method assigns the provided WebSocket client to the internal instance variable, enabling communication with the game's WebSocket server. The client is used to send and receive real-time updates during gameplay.
      Parameters:
      client - The GameWebSocketClient instance to associate with this object. Must not be null and should be properly initialized to handle WebSocket interactions.

    • setBackgroundMusic

      public void setBackgroundMusic(com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music music)
      Sets the background music to the specified Music object. This method updates the current background music track to the provided music parameter. If the provided music is null, this will clear the current background music. Note that calling this method does not automatically start playback of the new music; additional logic may be required to manage playback. Ensure the Music object is properly initialized and loaded before invoking this method to avoid potential resource errors.
      Parameters:
      music - The Music object to be used as the new background music. Can be null to stop or remove the current background music.

    • getBackgroundMusic

      public com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music getBackgroundMusic()
      Retrieves the background music associated with this instance. The returned Music object represents the current background audio track configured for playback. This method provides access to the stored music resource, which may be null if no background music has been set. The returned instance is the same as the one managed internally, so modifications to the object (if mutable) may affect the application's background music state.
      Returns:
      the Music instance used as background music, or null if none exists.

    • isArrowControlsEnabled

      public boolean isArrowControlsEnabled()
      Returns whether arrow-based controls are enabled for navigation or interaction within the system. This setting determines if directional input (e.g., via keyboard arrow keys) is actively processed to adjust focus, movement, or other UI/application behavior.
      Returns:
      true if arrow controls are currently active and accepting input, false if arrow-based navigation is disabled and input events are ignored.

    • setArrowControlsEnabled

      public void setArrowControlsEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether the arrow controls are enabled or disabled. When enabled, the arrow controls allow user interaction for navigation or input purposes. Disabling this prevents the arrow controls from being used until re-enabled.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable the arrow controls, false to disable them.

    • stopBackgroundMusic

      public void stopBackgroundMusic()
      Stops the background music playback if it is currently active. This method checks if the backgroundMusic instance is initialized (not null) before invoking its stop() method to prevent null pointer exceptions. If the background music is playing, it will cease playback and release associated resources. If no background music is loaded or already stopped, this method has no effect. Safe to call even when background music is not actively playing.

    • startBackgroundMusic

      public void startBackgroundMusic()
      Starts playback of the background music if it has been initialized. This method checks whether the background music resource is available (non-null) and, if so, invokes its play() method to begin playback. If the background music has not been initialized or is null, this method performs no action and exits silently.

    • setGameScreen

      public void setGameScreen(GameScreen gameScreen)
      Sets the current game screen to the specified GameScreen instance. This method updates the internal reference to the active game screen, allowing the application to control which screen is currently being displayed or interacted with.
      Parameters:
      gameScreen - The GameScreen instance to set as the active screen. This parameter must not be null to ensure proper functionality.
